title.narrative: Territorial Economic Empowerment for the Indigenous, Afro-Ecuadorians and Montubian Peoples and Nationalities (TEEIPAM)

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to improve livelihoods and support COVID-19 relief for targeted Indigenous Peoples and Nationalities, Afro-Ecuadorians, and Montubians, in accordance with their vision and priorities for development.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: Create at least five (5) territorial teams (PIU Territorial teams) to be housed in IEPS' existing zonal and district offices, withfunctions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank as set forth in the Operational Manual, during the first year of Projectimplementation, all responsible for the coordination of Project activities within their respective Prioritized Territories
IEPS will install complementary information system to monitor the implementation of Subprojects not later than three hundred (300)days after the Effective Date.

Not later than one hundred and twenty (120) days after the Effective Date, ensure that a Project manager, technical/operationscoordinator, financial management, procurement, social and environmental specialists, and three (3) IPAM advisors are assigned towork full time within the PIU under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank;

Not later than thirty (30) days after the Effective Date, establish, and thereafter maintain during Project implementation, a “PIU”within SMDPN, with functions and responsibilities acceptable to the Bank as set forth in the Operational Manual, including, interalia, the responsibility to coordinate, manage, implement, monitor and supervise the carrying out of the Project.

Not later than two hundred seventy (270) days after the signing of the Effective Date, a financial management specialist will behired to work full time within the PIU under terms of reference acceptable to the Bank;

Prior to carrying out any activities under Part 2.1., 2.2., 2.3. and 3.2. of the Project, the Borrower shall ensure that, aninter-institutional agreement is signed between SMDPN and IEPS (“IEPS Inter-Institutional Agreement”), under terms and conditionssatisfactory to the Bank, including, inter alia, the roles and responsibilities of SMDPN and IEPS for implementing Part 2.1., 2.2.,2.3. and 3.2.

Prior to carrying out any activities under Part 3.1. of the Project, the Borrower shall ensure that, an inter-institutionalagreement is signed between SMDPN and SENESCYT (“SENESCYT Inter-Institutional Agreement”), under terms and conditions satisfactoryto the Bank, including, inter alia, the roles and responsibilities of SMDPN and SENESCYT for implementing Part 3.1.

title.narrative: Partnership agreements signed with universities, cultural institutes and technical programs for strengthening IPAM attendance
IPAM community banks formed and strengthened
IPAM women's active participation in structured dialogue platforms at the national and territorial levels
Subproject investments financed under the Project that are operational/completed and assessed as good quality in technical audit
Grievances responded and/or resolved within the stipulated service standards for response times
New internships or jobs for IPAMs facilitated by Project-financed activities (disaggregated by P/N and gender)
IPAMs in beneficiary territories that feel project investments reflect development priorities/needs established during planning process (disaggregated by P/N and gender)
Direct IPAM project beneficiaries (disaggregated by gender)
IPAM beneficiaries in selected territories that have secured, for the first time, formal financial services from FIs supported by the Project (disaggregated by gender)
New IPAM associations/companies led by IPAMs established under the Project (disaggregated by gender)
IPAMs Strategic Development Investment Plans (SDIPs) are developed and validated using territorial platforms
IPAM women in prioritized territories that have secured, for the first time, formal financial services from FIs supported by the Project
New internships or jobs for female IPAMs facilitated by Project-financed activities (disaggregated by P/N)
Increase in attendance of IPAMs in participating in higher education programs (disaggregated by P/N and gender)
IPAM households benefiting from livelihood subprojects and investments
National Platform for structured dialogue between IPAM representatives and the State is established and operational
